task.title: View events
task.shortdesc: To learn more information about the events, click on an icon in the timeline or map. The metadata/description for that event will popup, and users are able to scroll through the information.

step.cmd: Scroll through the timeline or map until you have found an event that you would like to know more about.
Click on that event to bring up a popup with more information about that event.

info.p: When you click on one of these event points in the map, the timeline will move until that event is visible. The informational popup will then appear in both the map and the timeline. When you click on an event in the timeline, the map will move to the location of that event and the information popup for that event will appear in both the timeline and the map.

step.cmd: Scroll through the event metadata to learn more about that event. Each event contains metadata that informs the user about the event. This metadata includes a label, date, location, country, description, and event type.

info.p: In the map, do not use the smart feature of your mouse or trackpad to scroll through the event description, this will zoom in or out of the map and loose the popup. Users must manually scroll, by clicking on the scroller available in the popup.
